As pure a game as you'll find, Schizoid is the new "Geometry Wars." [Oct 2008, p.84]
It brings the sport of soccer to life in vibrant detail and fairly solid controls, even though the lack of modes is a bit off-putting.
Alone in the Dark proves that with a little time and patience, a good game can be created from innovative ideas.
A run of the mill sports title.
For the sheer amount of fun that strategy fans will have with this XBLA offering, it's very easy to overlook its few imperfections.
Despite some boring missions, the customization and online fights were great fun, to say the least.
This is a good fighting game in its own right, but with Soulcalibur and the new Street Fighter around the corner this game may be left on the ropes.
The best PlayStation espionage game since "Metal Gear Solid."
Multiplayer support and two decently-long episodes equals a good bit of gaming for fifty bucks.
Midway rounded out a decent looking, sounding, and playing game with good Blitz mechanics that will make any fan smile in delight.
Overall a great adventure game, would like to see a bit more "polish" to the game and an inventory system to work around the item backtracking.
Simply, one of the most fun games on 360. Defy those who say it won't sell! [Aug 2007, p.74]
